headline: FedEx Expects Higher Costs From MD-11 Grounding in December
summary: $25 million   That's the extra costs FedEx incurred in November after the UPS cargo plane crash led to the grounding of all MD-11 planes.   FedEx expects higher costs for December, during peak parcel season.

headline: Why FedEx Stock Is Falling Despite Earnings Surprise And Price Target Hikes
summary: FedEx was handed a number of price target increases early Friday after the company reported better-than-expected fiscal 2026 second-quarter profit and revenue, while also revising fiscal 2026 guidance after Thursday's stock market close.  "FedEx delivered an outstanding second quarter as we successfully executed our growth strategy and advanced our network transformation, while navigating a highly challenging external environment," FedEx CEO Raj Subramaniam said in the earnings release Thursday.  "I am extremely proud of our team members worldwide for their commitment to make every FedEx experience outstanding this peak season."

headline: FedEx Earnings Were Strong. The Stock Is Down.
summary: A lot is going on at  FedEx  so the stakes were high for its second-quarter results, reported Thursday evening.  For the fiscal second quarter, FedEx reported adjusted earnings per share of $4.82 from sales of $23.5 billion.  “FedEx delivered an outstanding second quarter as we successfully executed our growth strategy and advanced our network transformation, while navigating a highly challenging external environment,” said Raj Subramaniam, FedEx CEO, in a news release.

headline: Fresh Look at UPS (UPS) Valuation After Recent Share Price Momentum
summary: Fresh look at United Parcel Service after mixed share performance United Parcel Service (UPS) has quietly climbed about 10% over the past month and 21% in the past 3 months, even though the stock is still down sharply over the past year. See our latest analysis for United Parcel Service. That recent 10.46% 1 month share price return and 21.44% 3 month share price return suggest momentum is finally turning up again, even though the 1 year total shareholder return is still firmly negative and...
